Research experience

Research assistant, Princeton Univ. Dept. of Physics

  • Dates: May 2021 - present
  • I am working closely with Professor Mariangela Lisanti and Dr. Oren Slone to continue and expand on my senior thesis investigations of self-interacting dark matter models through a study of the Sagittarius dwarf spheroidal galaxy.

Machine learning intern, Pacific Northwest National Laboratory

  • Dates: May 2021 - present
  • I am working again with Dr. Jan Strube on the Belle II experiment.

Senior thesis, Princeton Univ. Dept. of Physics

  • Dates: Sep 2020 - May 2021
  • I worked closely with Professor Mariangela Lisanti to investigate the effects of dark matter self-interaction on the resulting evolution of the Sagittarius stellar stream.

Independent research project, Princeton Univ. Program in Applied and Computational Mathematics

  • Dates: Dec 2020 - Apr 2021
  • I worked with Professor Adam Burrows of the Princeton Univ. Dept. of Astrophysics to build a numerical solver implementing a recently-developed Kompaneets formalism to describe the evolution of neutrino distributions as a result of inelastic neutrino-nucleon scattering in core-collapse supernovae.

Machine learning intern, Pacific Northwest National Laboratory

  • Dates: Jun 2020 - Sep 2020
  • I worked with Dr. Jan Strube to develop a novel point cloud neural network to perform particle identification with the Time-of-Propagation (TOP) detector at the Belle II experiment.

Junior papers, Princeton Univ. Dept. of Physics

  • Dates: Sep 2019 - May 2020
  • For the spring 2020 semester, I worked with Professor William Jones and Dr. Aurelien Fraisse to study methods for quantifying the degree to which maps of the CMB polarization had been successfully cleaned from galactic dust by using maps of galactic HI.
  • For the fall 2019 semester, I worked with Professor Herman Verlinde to perform a review of the physics of gravitational wave creation, propagation, and detection.

Student Undergraduate Laboratory Internship (SULI), Pacific Northwest National Laboratory

  • Dates: May 2019 - Sep 2019
  • I worked closely with Dr. Jan Strube to perform in-depth studies of the performance of the Time-of-Propagation detector at the Belle II experiment, a unique form of Cherenkov detector.
